III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Incident reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that Youth A AWOLed and the referring agency did
not receive notification of the AWOL.
Investigation On 9/9/24, I spoke to Complainant. No new information was
provided.
On 9/9/24, I spoke to Foster Care Worker 1 (FCW 1). FCW 1
reported she was never notified of Youth A AWOLing from the
facility. FCW 1 reported the AWOL occurred the week of 8/25/24.
FCW 1 did not have the specific date. FCW 1 reported she had
made numerous phone calls, and no one was returning her phone
call.
On 9/9/24, I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 did not
provide any new details.
I spoke to Administrator 2. Administrator 2 reported Youth A
AWOLed on 8/22/24. Administrator 2 reported Therapist 1 wrote
the incident report and stated she sent the incident report to
FCW 1 on 8/22/24. There were no other AWOLS for that week.
Administrator 1 was asked if Administrator 3 would be aware of
AWOLs at the facility and Administrator 2 reported he is not
involved in the day-to-day activities and may not be able to
distinguish between an AWOL and a youth walking away from the
group, (which is not an AWOL).
I spoke to Therapist 1. Therapist 1 reported she sent Youth A’s
incident report concerning his AWOL on 8/22/24 to FCW 1 on
8/22/24. Therapist 1 reported she is the one who communicates
with the youth’s workers. Therapist 1 reported the only AWOLS for
Youth A were the ones with incident reports noted.
2

Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 8/22/24. The Incident report is written
by Therapist 1 and does note that FCW 1 was informed of
the incident and received the Incident Report.
• Email from FCW 1 to Therapist 1. The email is dated
8/23/24. The email reads as follows and had the Incident
report attached:
o Good afternoon, we received a voicemail message
today indicating [Youth A] has been AWOL since
yesterday-could someone from Holy Cross provide
additional details? We are in need of the report
number associated with the police report noting
them as AWOL. What additional actions have been
taken to resolve the AWOL episode…
• Email thread from FCW 1 to Therapist 1:
o On 8/30/24, FCW 1 requested more incident reports
via email for a specific AWOL, dated 8/26/24. FCW 1
indicated that Administrator 3 told her this occurred.
Therapist 1 sent FCW 1 all the incident reports she
had for the month of August 2024.There was no
incident report for this date.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule.
• FCW 1 was informed of the 8/22/24 AWOL immediately
after it happened.
• On 8/30/24, FCW 1 inquired about an AWOL that allegedly
occurred on 8/26/24. There is not an incident report for an
AWOL and both Administrator 2 and Therapist 1 reported
there was not an AWOL for that date.
• Administrator 3 is not involved in day-to-day operations and
would not know specific youth behaviors or specific dates
to AWOLs. FCW 1 did not obtain information from
Therapist 1, which is the normal communication route.
When she did communicate with Therapist 1, she received
information that there was not an AWOL on 8/26/24.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(g) Methods for dispensing medication when the resident will be
off site.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged Youth B was placed in detention and the facility did
not provide medications to the youth.
Investigation On 9/9/24, I spoke to Complainant. No new information was
provided.
On 9/9/24, I spoke to FCW 1. FCW 1 reported Youth B went to a
detention facility on 8/25/24. FCW 1 reported when he left Holy
Cross Queen of Angels, he was not provided his medication for
his detention stay. FCW 1 reported she did not know this as a fact
and assumed he hadn’t. FCW 1 reported she contacted Holy
Cross, and they said they did give Youth B his medications, but
she wanted someone to find out for sure.
On 9/9/24, I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
she personally dropped off Youth B’s medications at the detention
facility on 8/27/24.
Youth B was unable to be interviewed. Youth B was AWOL. Last
known location was at Common Grounds Facility. I spoke to
Administrator 4 on 11/12/24 and Youth B was never at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• On 9/17/24, I received MAR’s (Medication Administration
Records) from Nurse 1. These documents revealed Youth
B was not on site on 8/26/24 and 8/27/24.
• Chain of Custody document dated 8/27/24. This
document reported all medications were given at time of
discharge. The date of discharge from the program was
8/27/24.
4

Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Administrator 1 reported
she dropped off the medication at the detention facility for Youth
B. Medication documentation is completed for the date of
discharge. MAR’s documentation confirms this as well.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing Medication
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has not taken his psychotropic medications in 15 days.
Investigation
On 9/9/24, I spoke to Complainant. No new information was
provided.
On 9/9/24, I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
we would need to look at the MARS sheets to review Youth A’s
mediation distribution.
I interviewed Youth A on 11/18/24 at Wolverine Shelter Facility.
Youth A reported he was placed at Holy Cross Queen of Angels.
Youth A reported he took medication three times a day at Holy
Cross. Youth A reported the agency never refused to give him his
medications. Youth A reported there were times he refused to take
his medications.
Documents Reviewed:
• MARS (Medication Administration Records) for Youth A
from August 25-September 9, 2024. Youth A did not
receive his medication due to his own refusal on the
following dates: 8/27/24, 8/28/24, 9/3/24, 9/5/24, 9/8/24. All
other dates Youth A received his medication.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Youth A reported he has
taken his medication and all documentation reveals this.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
